SENIOR CONSTRUCTION MANAGER

SUMMARY

Construction Manager / On - Site Project Manager Â  Project Manager versed in all aspects of project and personnel management.
Results-oriented and high-energy professional with a talent for leading by example and inspiring peak performance.
History in turning "problemed" subdivisions into profitable projects through delivery of cost savings solutions and alternative scheduling techniques that allowed for more even flow of construction.
Decisive, results oriented building professional offering 18+ years of experience in the construction industry with the last 10 years focused on project management.
Offering a range of talents in scheduling/ expediting, customer service, sales, purchasing, estimating, land development, construction techniques and safety.
Driven by new challenges and desire to be successful in all endeavors.
Excel in fast paced settings that require multi tasking to complete complex tasks.
Summary of Qualifications
Concrete estimation Permit processing Baseline schedules creation Site safety coordinator Safe job site set-up Building codes and regulations Blueprint fluency Power and hand tool operation Residential construction specialist Multi Family construction specialist MS Office proficient Organized and detail-oriented Project budgeting Cost control
Budgeting and forecasting Customer relations specialist Process improvement Multi-unit operations management Risk management Vendor sourcing Quality assurance and control Certified Purchasing Manager (CPM) Purchasing and procurement Unsurpassed work ethic Results-oriented Cost reduction and containment Contract management Microsoft Office Suite expert Productivity improvement Work flow planning

2000 - 2008 Centex Homes
* Mansfield Farms - Suffolk Virginia - 150 Home Subdivision
* Mallory Square - Chesapeake Virginia - 25 Home Subdivision
* Braddock Landing - Chesapeake Virginia - 55 Home Subdivision
* Orchards at Glenwood - Virginia Beach - 61 Home Subdivision
* Courthouse Springs - Gloucester Virginia - 32 Home Subdivision
* Courthouse Square - Gloucester Virginia - 86 Home Subdivision
* Eagle Lake - Chesapeake Virginia - 99 Home Subdivision
2008 - 2011 Eagle Construction www.eagleofva.com
* Eagle Pointe - Chesapeake Virginia - 170 Homes Subdivision
2011 - 2015 Breeden Construction LLC www.thebreedencompany.com/
* Cambria at Cornerstone Phase 1 - 276 Unit Luxury Apartment Community
* Cambria at Cornerstone Phase 2 - 180 Unit Luxury Apartment Community
* Red Knot at Edinburgh - 438 Unit Luxury Apartment Community
* Aqua at 25th Street - 147 Unit Luxury Apartment Community (Current Project)

EXPERIENCE

Company Name

Senior Construction Manager

12/2011 to 07/2015
Hired to oversee construction of an Award Winning Luxury Apartment Community in the Town Center area of Virginia Beach.
Managed site from the clearing stages of Land Development through completion of the project in early 2013.
The site consisted of 24 buildings (480 units), 2 fitness centers, a clubhouse, 2 pools and several ground breaking amenities.
Currently working on third project in four years with Breeden Construction LLC Carefully coordinated plans and specs using marketing programming standards.
Facilitated processing of RFI's, submittals and samples among the general contractor, the owner and the owner's consultants.
Educated general contractor personnel on the quality standards throughout the construction process.
Trained the community service manager on turnover procedures, quality standards and project-specific systems orientation.
Submitted all project closeout documents in accordance with the contract.
Monitored the safety of all construction activities, making on-site personnel safety the top priority.

Responsible for managing 4 superintendents while development was under construction.
Reviewed time lines and project schedules and adjusted based on production.
Responsible for construction budgets, change orders, payroll and subcontractor fund allocations.
Contract review and negotiations with subcontractors.
Site / Land Development management during golf course alteration for new home construction.
Drafted action plans and led meetings with department executives to review project status and proposed changes.
Delivered status reports to stakeholders for budgeting and planning purposes.
Collaborated with cross-functional teams to draft project schedules and plans.

Recruited to company by Division President for the purpose of turning around projects that were behind schedule and over budget.
Personally revamped schedules to make up for production failures and created an even flow system that allowed for more streamlined construction procedures.
Managed multiple construction projects in Hampton Roads from Land Development to community completion.
Homes were move in ready on average two weeks prior to closing and were always at or under budget.
Served as the single point of contact for project scheduling and changes.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Sr Director, Construction and Facilities

Location: Los Angeles, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
The Senior Director of Construction and Facilities is a key leadership role responsible for creating and overseeing the standards, programs, and initiatives centered on building and maintaining our restaurants portfolio. The position will establish construction best practices, processes, resource planning and management for scale. It will work closely with design, development, and asset management to simplify construction and increase asset resilience and up time. This individual will lead a team of facilities managers to uphold our brand standards and ensure compliance with regulations. This role will work with Operations to develop a strong working partnership and interact with other support center departments to provide subject matter expertise and represent the needs of our operators and guests.

Responsibilities

The position is responsible for delivering the build-out of the pipeline for our profitable restaurant expansion. Performance is defined as exceeding the store week's plan, improving the unit economics by driving down Capex and increasing ROIC, and improving the processes and tools that help us reduce build-out time and accelerate our growth. This position will also co-author the capital plan for the existing fleet by working closely with the asset management team and operations to develop the capital reinvestment plan that best supports our teams, our customers, and our assets.

Manages maintenance and repair for all building systems including mechanical, electrical, plumbing, HVAC, general maintenance, and sustainability. Ensure all facilities work follows our company standards, conforms to specifications, and that work orders are tracked and managed within the budgeted guidelines.

Oversee the new store turnover process for scale, ensuring the team has a deep understanding of asset management and the ability to address unique issues that may impact facilities' upkeep on an ongoing basisBuild a resource allocation model, internally and externally, that unlocks rapid acceleration in new restaurant growth to protect and increase store weeks to planDevelop a Capital plan for New Restaurant Openings + Reinvestment, delivering a high ROIC and strategically reducing overall buildout cost for our growth pipelineLead the Construction center of excellence to build scalable tools for expanding our general contractor and vendor network, contracting and onboarding new partners, bidding and estimating projects, and sequencing construction schedules to accelerate pipeline countDevelop budget and strategies that optimize our repair and maintenance service to our restaurants, cost-effectively and efficiently, ensuring a positive guest experienceManage preventative maintenance schedules for all restaurants, equipment, and systemsEnsure compliance with safety standards and regulations for all restaurant facilitiesDrive continuous improvements for the organization by holding vendors accountable to established KPIs and actively consulting and training Operations teams on Facilities knowledge and ownershipPrepare capital allocation strategies to manage budgets associated with equipment replacement and remodels in partnership with Finance and Operations to Oversee Programmatic Equipment replacement projects executed by the Facilities ManagersManage, coach, and develop team of construction + facilities resources, and plan resource allocation for all projects and initiativesProvide active insights and input into functional design of facilities and choice of equipment to the design and construction team and influence decisions that are favorable for the long term upkeep of assets

You Are

An exceptional executive in the space of Facilities Management with strategic and functional skillsWell versed in Service Channel and its technology platforms to maximize its impact on R&M spend and trend analysisA strong leader, cross-functional collaborator, and proven expert in execution/implementationAble to travel 40-50% of the time

Qualifications

10+ years of prior experience in development in a construction and/or facilities leadership capacity in multi-unit environment; with emphasis on management in a restaurant environmentA bachelorâs degree in a relevant field or equivalent in education and experience. Certification in Restaurant Facilities Management Association, Facilities Management through International Facilities Management Association, or other organization preferredFinancial acumen and understanding of budgets, project planning, and estimatingStrong technical knowledge of all aspects of restaurant facilities maintenance, including HVAC, refrigeration, food prep and production equipment, electrical, plumbing and building systems and finishesStrong communication + management skills, both for executive-level reviews and for instruction + education with operations, via head coaches and restaurant teams. Knowledgeable in governing codes, safety (OSHA) rules, sanitation (NSF), and building codes (BOCA)Excellent consulting skills and ability to influence senior stakeholders to get things accomplished within a matrixed organization

What You'll Get

Highly competitive pay + bonus planThree different medical plans to suit your and your family's needsDental and Vision insuranceFlexible PTO plan401k programEmployee HSA and FSAComplimentary greensAn opportunity to make a real impact on the people around you, both by growing them and by connecting them to real foodTo live the sweetlife and celebrate your passion + purposeA collaborative team of people who live our core values and have your backA clear career path with opportunities for development, both personally and professionallyFree sweetgreen swag

Come join the sweetlife!

About Sweetgreen

sweetgreen is on a mission to build healthier communities by connecting people to real food. We passionately believe that real food should be convenient and accessible to everyone. Every day in each sweetgreen, our 3,500 team members make food from scratch, using fresh ingredients and produce delivered that morning. And in our local communities, weâre committed to leaving people better than we found them. Weâre in the business of feeding people, and weâre out to change what that means.
